channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: NTSB blames 'deep' systemic failures for deadly midair collision near Washington D.C.
item.description: After a yearlong investigation, the National Transportation Safety Board did not find a single cause for the deadly collision near Washington, D.C., but blamed the crash on multiple systemic failures.
item.content:encoded:
After a yearlong investigation, the National Transportation Safety Board did not find a single cause for the deadly collision near Washington, D.C., but blamed the crash on multiple systemic failures.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Bitter cold grips the eastern U.S. as storm deaths rise and power outages linger
item.description: Three Texas siblings who died in an icy pond are among several dozen deaths in U.S. states gripped by frigid cold. A massive storm dumped deep snow across more than 1,300 miles from Arkansas to New England.
item.content:encoded:
Three Texas siblings who died in an icy pond are among several dozen deaths in U.S. states gripped by frigid cold. A massive storm dumped deep snow across more than 1,300 miles from Arkansas to New England.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Minnesota gun safety expert weighs in on the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Rob Doar, president of the Minnesota Gun Owners Law Center, on his viewing of and reaction to the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Rob Doar, president of the Minnesota Gun Owners Law Center, on his viewing of and reaction to the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti.
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
item.description: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

(Image credit: Piero Cruciatti)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: What Tom Homan's leadership might mean in Minneapolis
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Caitlin Dickerson of The Atlantic about Tom Homan's career in law enforcement, and what she thinks his arrival in Minneapolis will mean for the immigration crackdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Caitlin Dickerson of The Atlantic about Tom Homan's career in law enforcement, and what she thinks his arrival in Minneapolis will mean for the immigration crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: Recovery from power outages is slow going in Nashville and other parts of the South
item.description: Power outages and cold temperatures continue to bare down on Nashville and other parts of the South.
item.content:encoded: Power outages and cold temperatures continue to bare down on Nashville and other parts of the South.
item.dc:creator: Blake Farmer

item.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins those calling for boycott of World Cup in U.S.
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.
item.content:encoded:
Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

(Image credit: Michael Probst)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Families of killed men file first U.S. federal lawsuit over drug boat strikes
item.description: The case filed in Massachusetts is the first lawsuit over the strikes to land in a U.S. federal court since the Trump administration launched a campaign to target vessels off the coast of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
The case filed in Massachusetts is the first lawsuit over the strikes to land in a U.S. federal court since the Trump administration launched a campaign to target vessels off the coast of Venezuela.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Trump sends border czar to Minnesota. And, trial over social media addiction begins
item.description: Border czar Tom Homan heads to Minnesota to replace Greg Bovino amid the immigration crackdown backlash. And a trial starts today to decide whether social media firms knowingly harm young users.
item.content:encoded:
Border czar Tom Homan heads to Minnesota to replace Greg Bovino amid the immigration crackdown backlash. And a trial starts today to decide whether social media firms knowingly harm young users.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Minnesota Gov. Walz says Trump agreed to 'consider' reducing number of ICE agents
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz says President Trump has agreed to "consider" reducing the number of federal agents in the state, following the killing of Alex Pretti.
item.content:encoded: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz says President Trump has agreed to "consider" reducing the number of federal agents in the state, following the killing of Alex Pretti.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic
